apiClassifier.shortdesc: TypedMap works as a wrapper for a map.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
TypedMap works as a wrapper for a map. It stores the wrapMap constructor's argument in the wrappedMap variable. So every method call to this class is forwarded to the wrappedMap object. The methods that need to be checked for the type of the keys and values are previously validated with the validateKeyType, validateValueType or validateMap method before forward the call. If the type of a key or value requested to be inserted to this map is incompatible with the type of the map a org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError is thrown. The calls that are forwarded to the wrappedMap returns the return of the wrappedMap call.
TypedMap does not allow null keys or values.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new TypedMap object.

apiException.apiDesc: if the wrapMap argument is null.
if the typeKeys argument is null.
if the typeValues argument is null.
if the types of one or more keys or values in the wrapMap argument are incompatible with the typeKeys or typeValues argument.

apiParam.apiDesc: the target map to wrap.
the type of the keys allowed by this map.
the type of the values allowed by this map.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
This method uses MapUtil.equalNotConsideringOrder or MapUtil.equalConsideringOrder method to perform equality, sending this map and other argument.
If wrappedMap is of type AbstractListMap then MapUtil.equalConsideringOrder method is used. Otherwise MapUtil.equalNotConsideringOrder method is used.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A map that provides a total ordering on its mappings.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
A map that provides a total ordering on its mappings. The map is ordered according to the natural ordering of its keys or values, by a IComparator typically provided at sorted map creation time, or by the arguments provided to the sort or sortOn methods.
For each change that occurs the map is automatically ordered using the comparator and options. If none was provided the default behavior of the sort method is used. The sortBy property defines whether the sorting will be made by key or value.
The user of this map may change their order at any time by calling the sort or sortOn method and imposing others arguments to change the sort behaviour.
It's possible to create typed sorted maps. You just sends the SortedArrayListMap object to the wrapper TypedSortedMap or uses the MapUtil.getTypedSortedMap.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new SortedArrayListMap object.

apiParam.apiDesc: a map with wich fill this map.
the comparator object to be used internally to sort.
the options to be used internally to sort.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new SortedArrayListMap object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new SortedArrayListMap object containing all elements in this map (in the same order).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new SortedArrayListMap object containing all elements in this map (in the same order).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new SortedArrayListMap object containing all elements in this map (in the same order).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Performs an arbitrary, specific evaluation of equality between this object and the other object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the arbitrary evaluation considers the objects equal.

apiParam.apiDesc: the object to be compared for equality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Performs an arbitrary, specific evaluation of equality between this object and the other object.
This implementation considers two differente objects equal if:
object A and object B are instances of the same class (i.e. if they have exactly the same type)
object A contains all mappings of object B
object B contains all mappings of object A
mappings have exactly the same order
object A and object B has the same type of comparator
object A and object B has the same options
object A and object B has the same sortBy
This implementation takes care of the order of the mappings in the map. So, for two maps are equal the order of mappings returned by the iterator must be equal.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key at the specified position in this map (optional operation).

apiParam.apiDesc: index at which the specified entry is to be inserted.
key with which the specified value is to be associated.
value to be associated with the specified key.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key at the specified position in this map (optional operation). Shifts the entry currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent entries to the right (adds one to their indices).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map (optional operation).

apiReturn.apiDesc: the previous value associated with key, or null if there was no mapping for key. (A null return can also indicate that the map previously associated null with key, if the implementation supports null values.)

apiParam.apiDesc: key with which the specified value is to be associated.
value to be associated with the specified key.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map (optional operation). If the map previously contained a mapping for the key, the old value is replaced by the specified value. (A map m is said to contain a mapping for a key k if and only if m.containsKey(k) would return true.)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Replaces the key at the specified position in this map with the specified key (optional operation).

apiReturn.apiDesc: the key previously at the specified position.

apiParam.apiDesc: index of the key to replace.
key to be stored at the specified position.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Replaces the key at the specified position in this map with the specified key (optional operation).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Replaces the value at the specified position in this map with the specified value (optional operation).

apiReturn.apiDesc: the value previously at the specified position.

apiParam.apiDesc: index of the value to replace.
value to be stored at the specified position.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Replaces the value at the specified position in this map with the specified value (optional operation).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sorts the elements in an array according to one or more fields in the array.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Sorts the elements in an array according to one or more fields in the array.
Consult Array.sortOn in the ActionScript 3.0 Language Reference in the link below for more info.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sorts the objects within this class.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Sorts the objects within this class.
For more info see org.as3coreaddendum.system.ISortable.sort() in the link below.

apiOperation.shortdesc: inheritDoc

apiException.apiDesc: if the subMap operation is not supported by this map.
if fromIndex or toIndex is out of range (index < 0 || index > size()).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new list that is a view of the specified range within this list.

apiParam.apiDesc: the index to start retrieving mappings (inclusive).
the index to stop retrieving mappings (exclusive).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: inheritDoc

apiValue.shortdesc: Defines the comparator object to be used automatically to sort.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Defines the comparator object to be used automatically to sort.
If this value change the map is automatically reordered with the new value.

apiValue.shortdesc: Defines the options to be used automatically to sort.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Defines the options to be used automatically to sort.
If this value change the list is automatically reordered with the new value.

apiValue.shortdesc: Defines whether the map should be sorted by its keys or values.

apiException.apiDesc: if try to set a null value.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Defines whether the map should be sorted by its keys or values. The default is SortMapBy.KEY.
If this value change the map is automatically reordered with the new value.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Hash table based implementation of the IMap interface.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Hash table based implementation of the IMap interface. This implementation provides all of the optional map operations, and permits null values and the null key.
This class makes no guarantees as to the order of the map. In particular, it does not guarantee that the order will remain constant over time.
It's possible to create typed maps. You just sends the HashMap object to the wrapper TypedMap or uses the MapUtil.getTypedMap.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new HashMap object.

apiParam.apiDesc: a map with wich fill this map.

instructs the backed Dictionary object to use "weak" references on object keys. If the only reference to an object is in the specified Dictionary object, the key is eligible for garbage collection and is removed from the table when the object is collected.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new HashMap object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes all of the mappings from this map.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes all of the mappings from this map. The map will be empty after this call returns.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new HashMap object containing all mappings in this map.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new HashMap object containing all mappings in this map.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new HashMap object containing all mappings in this map.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns an iterator over a set of mappings.

apiReturn.apiDesc: an iterator over a set of values.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns an iterator over a set of mappings.
This implementation returns a MapIterator object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the previous value associated with key, or null if there was no mapping for key. (A null return can also indicate that the map previously associated null with key, because this implementation supports null values.)

apiParam.apiDesc: key with which the specified value is to be associated.
value to be associated with the specified key.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map. If the map previously contained a mapping for the key, the old value is replaced by the specified value. (A map m is said to contain a mapping for a key k if and only if m.containsKey(k) would return true.)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes the mapping for a key from this map if it is present.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the previous value associated with key, or null if there was no mapping for key.

apiParam.apiDesc: the key whose mapping is to be removed from the map.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Removes the mapping for a key from this map if it is present.
Returns the value to which this map previously associated the key, or null if the map contained no mapping for the key. A return value of null does not necessarily indicate that the map contained no mapping for the key. It's possible that the map explicitly mapped the key to null.
The map will not contain a mapping for the specified key once the call returns.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Array based implementation of the IMap interface.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Array based implementation of the IMap interface. This implementation provides all of the optional map operations, and permits null values and the null key.
This class makes guarantees as to the order of the map. The order in which elements are stored is the order in which they were inserted.
This class has great similarity to ArrayList class. In a way this class can be thought of as an ArrayList of mappings.
It's possible to create typed list maps. You just sends the ArrayListMap object to the wrapper TypedListMap or uses the MapUtil.getTypedListMap.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new ArrayListMap object.

apiParam.apiDesc: a map with wich fill this map.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new ArrayListMap object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes all of the mappings from this map.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes all of the mappings from this map. The map will be empty after this call returns.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new ArrayListMap object containing all mappings in this map (in the same order).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new ArrayListMap object containing all mappings in this map.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new ArrayListMap object containing all mappings in this map (in the same order).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns an iterator over a set of mappings.

apiReturn.apiDesc: an iterator over a set of values.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns an iterator over a set of mappings.
This implementation returns a MapIterator object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a IListMapIterator object to iterate over the mappings in this map (in proper sequence), starting at the specified position in this map.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a ListMapIterator object to iterate over the mappings in this map (in proper sequence), starting at the specified position in this map.

apiParam.apiDesc: index of first value to be returned from the iterator (by a call to the next method)

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns a IListMapIterator object to iterate over the mappings in this map (in proper sequence), starting at the specified position in this map.
This implementation returns a ListMapIterator object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key at the specified position in this map.

apiException.apiDesc: if this map already contains the specified key.
if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index > size()).

apiParam.apiDesc: index at which the specified entry is to be inserted.
key with which the specified value is to be associated.
value to be associated with the specified key.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key at the specified position in this map. Shifts the entry currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent entries to the right (adds one to their indices).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the previous value associated with key, or null if there was no mapping for key. (A null return can also indicate that the map previously associated null with key, because this implementation supports null values.)

apiParam.apiDesc: key with which the specified value is to be associated.
value to be associated with the specified key.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map. If the map previously contained a mapping for the key, the old value is replaced by the specified value, and the order of the key is not affected. (A map m is said to contain a mapping for a key k if and only if m.containsKey(k) would return true.)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes the mapping at the specified position in this map (optional operation).

apiException.apiDesc: if the removeAt operation is not supported by this map.
if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size()).

apiReturn.apiDesc: an IMapEntry object containing the mapping (key/value) that was removed from the map.

apiParam.apiDesc: the index of the mapping to be removed.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Removes the mapping at the specified position in this map (optional operation). Shifts any subsequent mappings to the left (subtracts one from their indices). Returns an IMapEntry object containing the mapping (key/value) that was removed from the map.
This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationError.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes all of the mappings whose index is between fromIndex, inclusive, and toIndex, exclusive (optional operation).

apiException.apiDesc: if the removeRange operation is not supported by this map.
if fromIndex or toIndex is out of range (index < 0 || index > size()).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new map containing all the removed mappings.

apiParam.apiDesc: the index to start removing mappings (inclusive).
the index to stop removing mappings (exclusive).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Removes all of the mappings whose index is between fromIndex, inclusive, and toIndex, exclusive (optional operation). Shifts any subsequent mappings to the left (subtracts their indices).
If toIndex == fromIndex, this operation has no effect.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes the mapping for a key from this map if it is present.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the previous value associated with key, or null if there was no mapping for key.

apiParam.apiDesc: the key whose mapping is to be removed from the map.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Removes the mapping for a key from this map if it is present.
Returns the value to which this map previously associated the key, or null if the map contained no mapping for the key. A return value of null does not necessarily indicate that the map contained no mapping for the key. It's possible that the map explicitly mapped the key to null.
The map will not contain a mapping for the specified key once the call returns.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Replaces the key at the specified position in this map with the specified key (optional operation).

apiException.apiDesc: if the setKeyAt operation is not supported by this map.
if the class of the specified key prevents it from being added to this map.
if the specified key is null and this map does not permit null keys.
if this map already contains the specified key.
if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size()).

apiReturn.apiDesc: the key previously at the specified position.

apiParam.apiDesc: index of the key to replace.
key to be stored at the specified position.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Replaces the key at the specified position in this map with the specified key (optional operation).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Replaces the value at the specified position in this map with the specified value (optional operation).

apiException.apiDesc: if the setValueAt operation is not supported by this map.
if the class of the specified value prevents it from being added to this map.
if the specified value is null and this map does not permit null values.
if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size()).

apiReturn.apiDesc: the value previously at the specified position.

apiParam.apiDesc: index of the value to replace.
value to be stored at the specified position.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Replaces the value at the specified position in this map with the specified value (optional operation).
This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationError.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a new map that is a view of the portion of this map between the specified fromIndex, inclusive, and toIndex, exclusive.

apiException.apiDesc: if the subMap operation is not supported by this map.
if fromIndex or toIndex is out of range (index < 0 || index > size()).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new list that is a view of the specified range within this list.

apiParam.apiDesc: the index to start retrieving mappings (inclusive).
the index to stop retrieving mappings (exclusive).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns a new map that is a view of the portion of this map between the specified fromIndex, inclusive, and toIndex, exclusive.
The returned map supports all of the optional map operations supported by this map.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: An ArrayListMap that doesn't allow modifications.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: An ArrayListMap that doesn't allow modifications. It receives all the mappings by its constructor and can no longer be changed. All methods that change the map will throw an UnsupportedOperationError.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: TypedSortedMap works as a wrapper for a map.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
TypedSortedMap works as a wrapper for a map. It stores the wrapMap constructor's argument in the wrappedMap variable. So every method call to this class is forwarded to the wrappedMap object. The methods that need to be checked for the type of the keys and values are previously validated with the validateKeyType, validateValueType or validateMap method before forward the call. If the type of a key or value requested to be inserted to this map is incompatible with the type of the map a org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError is thrown. The calls that are forwarded to the wrappedMap returns the return of the wrappedMap call.
TypedSortedMap does not allow null keys or values.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new TypedSortedMap object.

apiException.apiDesc: if the wrapMap argument is null.
if the typeKeys argument is null.
if the typeValues argument is null.
if the types of one or more keys or values in the wrapMap argument are incompatible with the typeKeys or typeValues argument.

apiParam.apiDesc: the target map to wrap.
the type of the keys allowed by this map.
the type of the values allowed by this map.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new TypedSortedMap object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new TypedSortedMap object with the clone of the wrappedMap object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new TypedSortedMap object with the clone of the wrappedMap object.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new TypedSortedMap object with the clone of the wrappedMap object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Performs an arbitrary, specific evaluation of equality between this object and the other object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the arbitrary evaluation considers the objects equal.

apiParam.apiDesc: the object to be compared for equality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Performs an arbitrary, specific evaluation of equality between this object and the other object.
This implementation considers two differente objects equal if:
object A and object B are instances of the same class (i.e. if they have exactly the same type)
object A contains all mappings of object B
object B contains all mappings of object A
mappings have exactly the same order
object A and object B has the same type of comparator
object A and object B has the same options
object A and object B has the same sortBy
This implementation takes care of the order of the mappings in the map. So, for two maps are equal the order of mappings returned by the iterator must be equal.

Defines whether the wrappedMap should be sorted by its keys or values. The default is SortMapBy.KEY.
If this value change the wrappedMap is automatically reordered with the new value.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: TypedSortedMap works as a wrapper for a map.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
TypedSortedMap works as a wrapper for a map. It stores the wrapMap constructor's argument in the wrappedMap variable. So every method call to this class is forwarded to the wrappedMap object. The methods that need to be checked for the type of the keys and values are previously validated with the validateKeyType, validateValueType or validateMap method before forward the call. If the type of a key or value requested to be inserted to this map is incompatible with the type of the map a org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError is thrown. The calls that are forwarded to the wrappedMap returns the return of the wrappedMap call.
TypedSortedMap does not allow null keys or values.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new TypedSortedMap object.

apiException.apiDesc: if the wrapMap argument is null.
if the typeKeys argument is null.
if the typeValues argument is null.
if the types of one or more keys or values in the wrapMap argument are incompatible with the typeKeys or typeValues argument.

apiParam.apiDesc: the target map to wrap.
the type of the keys allowed by this map.
the type of the values allowed by this map.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new TypedListMap object with the clone of the wrappedMap object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Forwards the call to wrappedMap.getKeyAt.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a IListMapIterator object to iterate over the mappings in this map (in proper sequence), starting at the specified position in this map.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a IListMapIterator object to iterate over the mappings in this map (in proper sequence), starting at the specified position in this map.

apiParam.apiDesc: index of first value to be returned from the iterator (by a call to the next method)

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns a IListMapIterator object to iterate over the mappings in this map (in proper sequence), starting at the specified position in this map. The specified index indicates the first value that would be returned by an initial call to next. An initial call to previous would return the value with the specified index minus one.
This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationError.

apiOperation.shortdesc: The map is validated to be forwarded to wrappedMap.putAllAt.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The map is validated to be forwarded to wrappedMap.putAllAt.

apiOperation.shortdesc: The key and value are validated to be forwarded to wrappedMap.putAt.

apiException.apiDesc: if the type of the specified key or value is incompatible with this map.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedMap.put.

apiParam.apiDesc: index at which the specified mapping is to be inserted.
key with which the specified value is to be associated.
value to be associated with the specified key.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The key and value are validated to be forwarded to wrappedMap.putAt.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A HashMap that doesn't allow modifications.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A HashMap that doesn't allow modifications. It receives all the mappings by its constructor and can no longer be changed. All methods that change the map will throw an UnsupportedOperationError.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new ReadOnlyHashMap object.

apiException.apiDesc: if the source argument is null.

apiParam.apiDesc: an map to fill the list.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new ReadOnlyHashMap object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationError.

apiException.apiDesc: ReadOnlyHashMap is a read-only map and doesn't allow modifications.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationError.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new ReadOnlyHashMap object containing all mappings in this map.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new ReadOnlyHashMap object containing all mappings in this map.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new ReadOnlyHashMap object containing all mappings in this map.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns an iterator over a set of mappings.

apiReturn.apiDesc: an iterator over a set of values.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
